name: Normalize Node Records
PLEASE READ ME BEFORE RUNNING
info:
Make sure you read and understand the settings in the "Process Configuration" before you run.

Nodes with an * at the end of their name include node-specific information in the Description tab of those nodes.  Please review.

name: Build Node Diagnostic Entities
Build HVAC Device
func:
i = msg.thing.UID.replace(/:/g,"_")
i = i.replace("-","_")

discoveryBaseTopic = global.get("MQTTDiscoveryTopic") + "/climate/" + msg.thing.hass.UID_ha + "/hvac"
msg.topic = discoveryBaseTopic + "/config"

msg.payload =   {
                "name":                    msg.thing.label,
                "object_id":                global.get("namePrecursor") + msg.thing.label,
                "unique_id":                i,
                "enabled_by_default":       "true",
                "availability":         {"topic":                      msg.thing.hass.availabilityTopic,
                                        "payload_available":        msg.thing.hass.availabilityTopicOn,
                            	        "payload_not_available":    msg.thing.hass.availabilityTopicOff,
                            	        "value_template":           "{{ value_json." + msg.thing.hass.availabilityTopicAttr + " }}", 
                                },
                "device": {
                    "manufacturer":                 global.get("manufacturer"),
                    "via_device":                   global.get("via_device"),
                    "identifiers":                  msg.thing.hass.UID_ha,
                    "name":                         msg.thing.hass.label,
                    "model":                        "OneControl: "+ msg.thing.hass.UID_ha,
                    "sw_version":                   "1.0"
                    },
                "action_topic":                     "smarthome/items/"+i+"_status/state",
                "action_template":                  "{{ value_json.value }}",
                "current_temperature_topic":        "smarthome/items/"+i+"_inside_temperature/state",
                "current_temperature_template":     "{{ value_json.value }}",
                "fan_mode_command_topic":           "smarthome/items/"+i+"_fan_mode/set",
                "fan_mode_state_topic":             "smarthome/items/"+i+"_fan_mode/state",
                "fan_mode_state_template":          "{{ value_json.value }}",
                "fan_modes":                        ["auto", 
        	                                            "low", 
        	                                            "high"],
        	    "mode_command_topic":               "smarthome/items/"+i+"_hvac_mode/set",
                "mode_state_topic":                 "smarthome/items/"+i+"_hvac_mode/state",
            	"mode_state_template":              "{{ value_json.value }}",
            	"modes":                            ["heat", 
            	                                        "cool",
            	                                        "heat_cool",
            	                                        "off"],
            	"min_temp":                         45,
            	"max_temp":                         100,
            	"precision":                        1,
            	"retain":                           true,
            	"temperature_high_command_topic":   "smarthome/items/"+i+"_high_temperature/set",
            	"temperature_high_state_topic":     "smarthome/items/"+i+"_high_temperature/state",
            	"temperature_high_state_template":  "{{ value_json.value }}",
            	"temperature_low_command_topic":    "smarthome/items/"+i+"_low_temperature/set",
            	"temperature_low_state_topic":      "smarthome/items/"+i+"_low_temperature/state",
            	"temperature_low_state_template":   "{{ value_json.value }}",
            	"temp_step":                        1,
    }

node.send(msg)
discoveryBaseTopic = global.get("MQTTDiscoveryTopic") + "/sensor/" + msg.thing.hass.UID_ha + "/device_mode"
msg.topic = discoveryBaseTopic + "/config"
msg.payload =   {
                "name":                    msg.thing.label + " Device State",
                "object_id":                global.get("namePrecursor") + msg.thing.label + " Device State",
                "unique_id":                i + "_device_state",
                "enabled_by_default":       "true",
                "availability": {
                	"topic":                    msg.thing.hass.availabilityTopic,
                	"payload_available":        "online",
                	"payload_not_available":    "offline",
                	"value_template":           "{{ value_json.status }}", 
                },
                "device": {
                    "manufacturer":                 global.get("manufacturer"),
                    "via_device":                   global.get("via_device"),
                    "identifiers":                  msg.thing.hass.UID_ha,
                    "name":                         msg.thing.hass.label,
                    "model":                        "OneControl: "+ msg.thing.hass.UID_ha,
                    "sw_version":                   "1.0"
                    },
                "entity_category":                  "diagnostic",
                "state_topic":                     "smarthome/items/"+i+"_status/state",
                "value_template":                  "{{ value_json.value }}"
}
node.send(msg)
/*

msg.payload.hass.attributes.topic = discoveryBaseTopic + "/attributes"

*/

name: Pre-Process Individual Channels
Process Channels
File Options
Process Configuration
MQTT Options
Custom Sensors and Tools
func:
// This sensor displays any additional status details if the state is anything other than online
name = msg.thing.label + " Online Status Details"
property = "online_status_details"
baseTopic  =  global.get("MQTTDiscoveryTopic") + "/sensor/" + msg.thing.hass.UID_ha + "/" + property
msg.topic =  baseTopic + "/config"


msg.payload = {
    "name":                 name,
    "object_id":            global.get("namePrecursor") + name,
    "unique_id":            msg.thing.hass.UID_ha + " " + property,
    "entity_category":      "diagnostic",
    "state_topic":          msg.thing.hass.availabilityTopic,
    "value_template":       "{{ value_json.statusDetail }}",
    "availability":         {"topic":                      msg.thing.hass.availabilityTopic,
                            	"payload_available":        msg.thing.hass.availabilityTopicOn,
                            	"payload_not_available":    msg.thing.hass.availabilityTopicOff,
                            	"value_template":           "{{ value_json." + msg.thing.hass.availabilityTopicAttr + " }}", 
                                },
    "device":                {"manufacturer":       global.get("manufacturer"), 
                                "via_device":       global.get("via_device"),
                                "identifiers":      msg.thing.hass.UID_ha, 
                                "name":             msg.thing.label, 
                                "model":            global.get("model") + ": " + msg.thing.hass.UID_ha,
                                "sw_version":       global.get("sw_version")
                                },

    "enabled_by_default":   true
    
} 
node.send(msg)
 if (flow.get("startupAvailMsg") === true) {
     msg.payload = '{"status":"online","statusDetail":"Initial Discovery"}'
     msg.topic = msg.thing.hass.availabilityTopic
     node.send(msg)
 }

name: Format Event Message
This section connects to the OneControl system and pulls down event and state change info and writes it to MQTT
Data Format Conversions *
info: This node is used to translate between the two platforms.  In come cases, values need to be in upper case, some lower case, and some different vlaues entirely.

name: Raw Data Format Conversions *
info:
This node is used to round decimal values down to reasonable sizes to minimize the number of state changes as well as 
the number of MQTT messages that need to be processed.  It is also used to force certain values to lowercase which is needed for compatibility with Home Assistance

name: Format Message
Outbound Data Format Conversions *
info: This node is used to translate between the two platforms.  In come cases, values need to be in upper case, some lower case, and some different vlaues entirely.
